citation.article-title: Thermovirga lienii gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel moderately thermophilic, anaerobic, amino-acid-degrading bacterium isolated from a North Sea oil well.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thermovirga (Ther.mo.virâ€²ga. Gr. fem. n. therme heat; L. fem. n. virga rod; N.L. fem. n. Thermovirga the hot rod).
Cells occur singly or in chains and have the ability to form aggregates.
Cells are thermophilic and slightly halophilic.
Able to ferment proteinous substrates, some single amino acids and a limited number of organic acids, but not sugars, fatty acids or alcohols.
Able to reduce cystine and elemental sulfur to hydrogen sulfide.
The type species is Thermovirga lienii.
